title: Administrator
description:
FOSTERING PEOPLE

Role: Administrator – 11 Months Fixed Term

Salary: £19,500 Per Annum

Benefits: 30 days' Annual Leave + Bank Holidays, Company Pension, Life Assurance x2, Employee Discount Scheme, Medical Cash Plan & On-site Free Parking

Location: Office Based - Nottingham

ABOUT US

Fostering People is a highly accredited community based fostering agency with over 20 years' experience of changing lives.

Fostering People first opened its doors in 2000, when a local social worker came up with the idea of starting a new, independent fostering service in the East Midlands.

Her idea was to provide plenty of excellent personal support, right in the heart of the local community. Today, this still holds true – except we’re now present in even more communities: Scotland, the North East, North West, West Midlands, East of England and Yorkshire. In these places, the excellence of our work means we’re the preferred choice of partner for many local authorities, who trust us to provide a high quality and caring local service. Just as importantly, so do foster parents in these communities.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

We are seeking a reliable Administrator to join our friendly and dedicated team at Fostering People Nottingham.

DUTIES INCLUDE:

  • Undertake a wide range of administrative tasks and duties using keyboard, office and IT skills
  • Act as an admin support for foster carers and social workers
  • Co-ordination of training and meetings and events
  • Completion of monthly tasks according to deadlines
  • Recording of essential company information to third parties on our database (CHARMS)
  • Act as first point of contact for our customers and portray a positive, professional and helpful image of the organisation
  • Understand and follow unique processes
  • Note/Minute taking at meetings where appropriate
  • Cover reception duties (lunch/annual leaves)

ESSENTIAL CRITERIA:

  • Previous Administrative experience
  • Solid educational background to include GCSE Grade C (or equivalent) in English and Mathematics
  • Be able to evidence an understanding of the use of IT and electronic communications including the use of Microsoft Office in particular Word, Excel and Outlook email
  • A good knowledge of administrative systems and processes
  • Be able to demonstrate effective communication
  • Ability to work under pressure and handle changing priorities

For an informal discussion about this post please contact Sophie Weightman – Office Manager on 0115 9455445.

To be considered for this post, please complete an application.

No agencies please.

Fostering People is an equal opportunities employer and has been awarded the disability confident employer by the jobcentre plus. The successful applicant will be subject to a DBS check at enhanced level if successful for the position.

Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract

Salary: £19,500.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Free parking
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Store discount

Work Location: In person

title: Office Administrator
description:
Job Description - Office Administrator

title: Systems Administrator
description:
Benefits Include: Free Parking Social Events £2,000 Annual Training Budget £500 Employee Referral Scheme Cycle to Work Scheme Free Hosting Run any Desktop OS And More…


Hybrid Working – Office based work required as part of role.

CWCS Managed Hosting is a rapidly growing IT company based in Nottingham. We have thousands of customers in the UK and overseas using our shared web hosting, dedicated servers, colocation and cloud hosting services. We have an excellent reputation and deliver great customer service, high quality technical support and enterprise-grade hosting products.

Due to our continued growth we are looking to add to our excellent Systems Administration team. The role includes some on-call responsibilities, which are shared across other members of the team. As part of CWCS you will help to deliver service to meet our customer’s expectation, and in line with SLAs, ensuring that quality is delivered at every opportunity.

You must have a passion for technical issues, a keen eye for detail, and patience to investigate an issue and deliver a resolution in a timely fashion. Our Trustpilot reviews are indicative of our results so far, service means everything to our customers and our purpose is to always offer a level of service that goes above and beyond.

General Responsibilities

The Systems Administration team are critical in delivering services to our customers, being responsible for the management of key accounts, maintaining security best practice, supporting our 2nd line team, and working with the Sales departments on proposals.

You will take on different functions within the team, split across three areas:

Escalations – Help deliver resolutions to tickets that have been escalated from our 2nd line team, and dealing with high priority customers directly.

Maintenance – Carrying out server maintenance on customer’s operating systems and hardware. Proactive maintenance is critical to managing customer’s perceptions of our support.

Research and Development Training – Research new technologies and processes that help to automate our systems and deliver a consistent level of service. You will also be expected to continually train so that your knowledge helps the business deliver on its goals.

These functions have many components within them, a small example of these are:

  • Server provisioning, custom scripts, and migrations, ensuring they are completed on time and on budget.
  • Monitor the network and resolve issues appropriately.
  • Oversee the regular auditing and patching of core and customer systems.
  • Perform routine audits of systems and software.
  • Build relationships with key managed customers.
  • Train junior members of the technical operations centre.
  • Develop knowledgebase documentation.
  • Research, develop and implement new products and services.

The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate a commitment to quality and information systems standards and a strong technical aptitude and ability to research and resolve complex issues. You will be self-motivated and keen to work as part of a team.

Benefits

We offer an excellent salary for this level of position. Training budget of £2,000 per year to help you develop the skills that drive the growth of the business.

Experience

You should have a good knowledge of internet technologies, specifically those used to deliver website hosting. You should also be able to understand the interaction between hardware and software. Confidence of working with networks, and being able to diagnose faults is also crucial. Other areas of knowledge that would be required:

  • Experience of VMware (vSphere, vSAN) system administration and maintenance.
  • Linux and Windows administrative knowledge.
  • Virtualisation and virtual machine management.
  • Familiarity with open source tools.
  • Networking concept.
  • Diagnostic skills, and lateral thinking.
  • Basic database administration including MySQL (MariaDB) and MSSQL.
  • Ability to learn new technologies.
  • A Linux or Microsoft certification would be advantageous.
  • Evidenced right to work in the UK is a pre-requisite for this role.

This role would be of particular interest to someone with a qualification in a VMware looking to advance their career, and with a keen desire to improve their knowledge on a diverse amount of technologies.

Working Hours

37.5 hours per week including an on-call requirement

Job Type: Permanent

Salary: £30,000.00-£40,000.00 per year

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Further Information

For more information about our Systems Administrator role including a detailed job description, please contact jobs@cwcs.co.uk.

To Apply

To apply for this position, please send your CV and a cover letter to jobs@cwcs.co.uk.

No Agencies Please!

title: Administrator
description:
• Reputable business offering progression
  • Free Onsite parking, City Centre Location

About Our Client

Pioneering force in the engineering manufacturing sector, specialising in the creation of innovative products. With a strong commitment to quality and technological advancement, the business are at the forefront of shaping the future of the industry. Currently seeking a meticulous and detail-oriented Quotes Administrator to join the team and contribute to the efficiency of the quoting processes.

Job Description

Key Responsibilities of a Quotes Administrator:


  • Quote Preparation: Prepare accurate and timely quotes for customers based on product specifications and pricing guidelines.


  • Data Analysis: Collaborate with sales, engineering, and procurement teams to gather and analyse data for accurate quoting.


  • Communication: Maintain effective communication with internal teams to ensure clarity on product details, pricing, and customer requirements.


  • Documentation: Organise and maintain a comprehensive database of quotes, ensuring accuracy and accessibility.


  • Customer Interaction: Engage with customers to clarify requirements, provide additional information, and address any questions related to quotes.


  • Process Improvement: Identify opportunities to streamline and improve the efficiency of the quoting process.


  • Collaboration: Work closely with sales administrators, engineers, and other relevant departments to ensure seamless operations.

The Successful Applicant

The successful Quotes Administrator will have:


  • Proven experience as a Quotes Administrator, Sales Support, or in a similar administrator role.


  • Strong analytic skills with the ability to interpret technical data.


  • Meticulous attention to detail and a commitment to accuracy.


  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.


  • Proficiency in office software (Microsoft Office suite) and experience with quoting software.


  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and collaborative work environment.

What's on Offer

In return you will receive:


  • Opportunities for professional development and growth within a leading engineering manufacturing company.


  • A dynamic and innovative work environment.


  • The chance to contribute to the success of groundbreaking products in the engineering sector.
  • Generous company pension scheme
  • Discretionary company bonus

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
JOB TITLE: School Administrative Assistant - Term time hours
LOCATION: Leicester
SALARY: £21,192 to £21,579 Pro-rata
CONTRACT TYPE: Contract until October 2024
HOURS: 10.00am - 4.00pm (27.5 hour week) Monday to Friday

The COMPANY
Our client is a well-established Primary School based in Oadby, Leicester. They are a vibrant and multicultural primary school. For a maternity cover the school are looking to appoint an experienced person to undertake general administrative support and general reception duties.

The ROLE
The successful School Administrator will be required to do the following:

  • To support the Headteacher, Deputy headteacher and Office Manager in administrative tasks
  • To receive visitors, parents, carers, governors plus other guests, and deal with their requests in an efficient and professional manner and hospitality as appropriate
  • Maintain the pupil database
  • Maintain correspondence between school and parents e.g. letters to parents, parent mail, texting, staff briefing and school website etc.
  • Maintain the office diaries, calendar, and correspondence between school and parents.
  • To collect, record, and bank school income as necessary.
  • To record and monitor absences, attendance, daily registers, and liaison with outside agencies when needed.

The CANDIDATE
Our client is looking for School Administrator / receptionist applicants with the following experience and attributes:
  • Experience of working in an office environment, preferably within a school.
  • Experience of dealing with public face to face and on the telephone
  • Able to organise own work and work with others to meet deadlines.
  • Word, PowerPoint and Excel. SIMS experience (desirable, not essential)
  • Willingness to undertake training of the SIMS software used in Schools.
  • Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills.

ALTERNATIVE JOB TITLES: School Office Manager, School Administrator, School Office Administrator, Admin, Administrator, School Secretary

Leicester
Oadby
Wigston
Market Harborough
Great Glen
Kibworth

title: Administrator
description:
Job Description


We are looking for an Administrator to join our friendly team based in our East Midlands Airport office (DE74 2SA).

No payroll experience is required, as full training will be provided.

This position would suit an experienced Administrator looking to join a fast-growing business that can offer support, training and development and opportunities to enhance their career.

This is a full-time (40 hrs) permanent office-based position covering flexible business hours between 0830 hrs – 1730 hrs Monday to Friday.

In return, the Office Administrator will be offered:
  • Opportunities to win our Employee of the month recognition programme, including £100 in vouchers + champagne + trophy.
  • Paid day off on your birthday and for Christmas shopping.
  • Dress down Fridays + Free tea and coffee.
  • High street retail discounts subscription (PerkBox).
  • Free onsite airport parking to use on your holidays.

The duties of the Office Administrator will involve:
  • Processing of payroll, SSP and Holiday Pay onto the company database.
  • Administer pay and client rate and legislative changes onto CRM.
  • Assisting Credit Control team with payroll and invoice queries.
  • Processing company car mileage and business expenses.
  • Processing new starters and leavers and P45 requests.
  • Assisting with monthly payroll and compliance audits.
  • Assist Recruitment Consultants and Senior Managers with day-to-day administrative support.

To be successful in the role of Office Administrator, you must have the following skills and experience:

  • Experience working as an Office Administrator, Sales Administrator, Administration Assistant, and Customer Service Administrator. Finance Administrator or
Credit Control Administrator where your duties have involved outbound telephone and data input activity.
  • Experience in working on multiple administrative tasks.
  • Experience with Microsoft Outlook, Word and Excel.
  • Working to strict deadlines.

About the Company:

Aviation Recruitment Network Ltd is one of the UK’s recognised specialist suppliers of high-volume security-cleared personnel for the Commercial Aviation Industry.

Our clients range from airport operators, international airlines, ground handling companies, support services, and household names in hospitality, transport, and logistics.

If you feel you have the skills and experience for this position, we would love to hear from you.
Click the link below or call our office to speak to Steve Freeman.

title: Data Administrator
description:
I have an unmissable opportunity up for grabs for the role of C# Software developer, (mid level or Junior)!

·Are you passionate about creating excellent code?

·Would you like to work with a fantastic tech stack?

·Would you like to work for a company that values your time so offers hybrid working enabling you to both do your best work and maintain a healthy work life balance?

·Would you like to work alongside a 1st class team in a collaborative environment working to best agile practices?

·Are you looking for career progression within a company that has clear paths to furthering your career?

title: Administrator
description:
PA Administrator

Location: West Bridgford, Nottingham

Salary: up to £36,000 + discretionary bonus

Hours: Full time (35-hour week)

An excellent opportunity has arisen for a professional PA or Administrator with Financial Services experience, to join this friendly and proactive St. James’s Place Partner Practice, who specialise in providing bespoke Financial Planning solutions for Professionals, Private Clients, and Business Owners.
This is an interesting and rewarding role that would suit a proactive, confident, and professional individual with a willingness to take on responsibility, and a real ‘eye for detail.’

The Role: PA Administrator

Based in a brand-new office in a central location you will be working closely with the Partner providing a high level of operational and administrative support and superb customer service to clients of the Practice.

  • You will be meeting and greeting visitors to the practice and be the ‘Go To person’ for clients, building effective working relationships.
  • You will be responsible for managing the partner’s diary, arranging, and preparing for client meetings, collating data for reports, illustrations, and portfolio reviews.
  • You will be dealing with general enquiries, chasing providers for funds and information, and liaising with SJP back-office teams.
  • You will be responsible for submitting new business (mainly pensions and investments) ensuring this is recorded and tracked efficiently and in line with Practice and regulatory standards.
  • Managing the database of clients using Salesforce CRM
  • Composing high quality correspondence to clients and providers
  • You will understand the importance of getting things right first time, so your attention-to-detail is second to none.

For this role you will need the following attributes:

  • A proven track record as an effective Administrator
  • Highly organised and able to make independent decisions.
  • Experience of prioritising your workload, managing tasks, processes, and workflows.
  • Confidence in dealing with clients, colleagues, third parties and the ability to work autonomously and with total discretion.
  • Experience of Salesforce CRM
  • Knowledge of Aptus would be an advantage
  • Experience of working for a St. James’s Place Partner Practice or in a Financial Services business is an advantage but not essential.

The office is based in an easy to get to central location with free parking. Other benefits include a discretionary bonus, pension, and 25 days holidays + bank holidays, increasing each year to a maximum of 30.

St. James’s Place Wealth Management plc (SJP) is a leading, and highly regarded, FTSE 100 UK Wealth Management company which distributes a range of Investment and Retirement products and financial solutions to a High-Net-Worth client base. SJP has funds under management in excess of £157bn.
Please note that this Partner Practice will conduct a standard Financial and Identity check on any candidates who are offered a role within this Practice.


When applying for this role, you will be directed to the application site of Burgh Recruitment. Please ensure you tick the Privacy Policy box and click the green 'apply to this job' at the bottom of the application page. Once your application is completed, you will receive a confirmation email from Burgh Recruitment.

I'm looking for an experienced SQL Server Database Administrator to join a 3 x Microsoft Gold Certified Managed Services Provider, who specialise in DBA and development work. They are a relatively small and close-knit company, who operate on a fully-remote basis, with quarterly meet ups to get together, socialise, and celebrate their successes!

Reporting into their Technical Team Lead, you will work as part of a growing team of DBAs to support their clients with both their on-premises and Azure-based servers, as well as helping with any migration projects where relevant.

This role is client-facing, so would be suited to someone who enjoys building relationship, solving problems, and providing exceptional customer service in everything that you do. Everyone on the team takes their turn being on-call, so realistically you can expect to spend 1 week in every couple of months on call (exact rota to be confirmed).

This is a really unique and exciting opportunity to join a successful organisation who are very much involved in the Microsoft community - they are home to a Microsoft MVP, are active participants at SQLBits, and have previously been nominated for a coveted Women in Tech Award.

In return for your hard work, you can expect to receive significant training support towards your Microsoft Certifications, as well as the freedom to explore your areas of interest.

  • Strong SQL Server DBA experience, on-premises and ideally on Azure too
  • Experience working on migration projects to Azure would be beneficial
  • Any experience with SSIS, SSRS, SSAS, Power BI would be beneficial

Benefits

  • 10% matches pension
  • 25 days annual leave, and additional day off for birthday
  • 2 volunteering days per year
  • Paid certifications & training

title: Data Administrator
description:
Summary

Job Reference:
222490BR

Nottingham Support Office

Fixed Term

37.5 hours per week

Our application process

Article Data Administrator – Boots UK

Location: Nottingham Support Office
Function area: Commercial Operations
Shift pattern: Full-time
Contract type: 9 month secondment / Fixed Term Contract
Hours per week: Over 35 hours per week

Article Data Administrator (Secondment / Fixed Term)

An exciting opportunity has arisen for an Article Data Administrator at Boots UK, the UK’s leading pharmacy-led Health and Beauty retailer. With around 2,200 stores ranging from local community pharmacies to large destination health and beauty stores, our purpose is to help our customers look and feel better than they ever thought possible. Boots UK is part of the Retail Pharmacy International Division of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc, the first global pharmacy-led health and wellbeing enterprise. For over 170 years Boots UK have been providing customers with an excellent customer experience, selling products with outstanding value, quality and choice.

About the role:
Join the Master Data Team within Commercial Operations whose principal responsibilities are the timely, accurate and controlled management of master data. The Article Data Administrator role focuses on creating and maintaining products for sales in our stores and online platform across UK and Ireland markets. Without this service products wouldn’t be available for sale.

This is an opportunity to work in a great, fast paced team with lots of opportunity and support to develop. You will have visibility of numerous departments across the business and be encouraged to drive change. The key activities involved in the role means you will have an appreciation of end to end article creation process.

Key Responsibilities:
  • To manage the timely and accurate creation and maintenance of Boots products, validating data in line with given standards
  • Achieving agreed Key Performance Indicators (KPI’s) within the role
  • Support and coach customers with data requirement queries daily
  • Produce team and customer KPI’s, such as volumes and customer rework reporting
  • Demonstrate process improvements to drive simplification
  • Governance is a key part of the role, to support communication and engagement with customers in order to deliver right first time data

A bit about you:
  • Ability to multitask and prioritise workload alongside good time management
  • The ability to work towards and hit firm deadlines
  • Well organised, excellent short and long-term planning, with brilliant attention to detail, with a right first time attitude
  • Strong ability to communicate effectively whether face to face, telephone or email
  • Collaborative team working and relationship building
  • Positive attitude, ability to deal with last minute changes and queries
  • Works well under pressure and to tight deadlines
  • Self-motivator, confident and able to use initiative to create and/or seek out solutions
  • Ability to be adaptable and flexible
  • Knowledge of Microsoft office (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, Word) essential

Our benefits:
  • Boots Retirement Savings Plan
  • Generous employee discount plus enhanced discounts for Boots brands, Boots Opticians and Boots Hearing care
  • Excellent onsite facilities including staff shop, opticians (including free eye tests for team members), gym, cafeteria, outdoor seating spaces and dry cleaning service

We have a great range of benefits in addition to the above that go beyond salary and offer flexibility to suit you;(all rewards and benefits are subject to change and eligibility).

Hybrid Working:
We offer our Support Office team members a flexible, hybrid working approach based upon empowerment, accountability, care, and trust, which includes a balanced mix of remote and office-based working - this will be discussed with you as part of the application process.

What’s next:
If your application is successful, our in-house recruitment team will be in touch to arrange an interview and to answer any initial questions you have. If you have not been successful on this occasion, you’ll be notified by email.

title: Administrator
description:
FOSTERING PEOPLE

Role: Administrator – 11 Months Fixed Term

Salary: £19,500 Per Annum

Benefits: 30 days' Annual Leave + Bank Holidays, Company Pension, Life Assurance x2, Employee Discount Scheme, Medical Cash Plan & On-site Free Parking

Location: Office Based - Nottingham

ABOUT US

Fostering People is a highly accredited community based fostering agency with over 20 years' experience of changing lives.

Fostering People first opened its doors in 2000, when a local social worker came up with the idea of starting a new, independent fostering service in the East Midlands.

Her idea was to provide plenty of excellent personal support, right in the heart of the local community. Today, this still holds true – except we’re now present in even more communities: Scotland, the North East, North West, West Midlands, East of England and Yorkshire. In these places, the excellence of our work means we’re the preferred choice of partner for many local authorities, who trust us to provide a high quality and caring local service. Just as importantly, so do foster parents in these communities.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

We are seeking a reliable Administrator to join our friendly and dedicated team at Fostering People Nottingham.

DUTIES INCLUDE:

  • Undertake a wide range of administrative tasks and duties using keyboard, office and IT skills
  • Act as an admin support for foster carers and social workers
  • Co-ordination of training and meetings and events
  • Completion of monthly tasks according to deadlines
  • Recording of essential company information to third parties on our database (CHARMS)
  • Act as first point of contact for our customers and portray a positive, professional and helpful image of the organisation
  • Understand and follow unique processes
  • Note/Minute taking at meetings where appropriate
  • Cover reception duties (lunch/annual leaves)

ESSENTIAL CRITERIA:

  • Previous Administrative experience
  • Solid educational background to include GCSE Grade C (or equivalent) in English and Mathematics
  • Be able to evidence an understanding of the use of IT and electronic communications including the use of Microsoft Office in particular Word, Excel and Outlook email
  • A good knowledge of administrative systems and processes
  • Be able to demonstrate effective communication
  • Ability to work under pressure and handle changing priorities

For an informal discussion about this post please contact Sophie Weightman – Office Manager on 0115 9455445.

To be considered for this post, please complete an application.

No agencies please.

Fostering People is an equal opportunities employer and has been awarded the disability confident employer by the jobcentre plus. The successful applicant will be subject to a DBS check at enhanced level if successful for the position.

title: Data Administrator
description:
Our Incora Story is really taking off – we’d love you to join us for the journey!

We are currently seeking a fantastic German speaking Data Administrator to join us at our site in Derby. The successful candidate will be fluent in both English and German.

As the leading supply chain solutions business in the aerospace industry, our customers are at the heart of our business.

As a Data Administrator your role will be to update current data and process new data to ensure that it remains accurate and up to date for customers.

You will use pricing files from either the customer or internal procurement to ensure correct pricing is on the system and conduct data audits when necessary.

You will work in a team environment, whilst also working cross functionally to drive customer service and performance.

This entry level role is a great opportunity for someone looking to grow and develop a career within an evolving organisation.

About You

You will have excellent attention to detail and have gained some data entry experience in a previous role.

Ideally, you will know your way around Excel, however, training will be given. It is also desirable for you to have some knowledge or understanding of how a supply chain operates.

You will be an enthusiastic and willing learner with a readiness to work in a global, fast paced, dynamic working environment.

You will be a German speaker with the ability to communicate both verbally and in written form at a fluent, professional level.

Most importantly you will be passionate about our Incora Values and exceeding customer expectations:

  • Courage - Take ownership for issues and problems.
  • Collaboration - Share knowledge and experience with others
  • Commitment - Focus on ensuring internal and external customer expectations are met in a timely way.

In return we will offer the things that matter:

  • Starting salary between £22,000 - £25,000.
  • We want you to share in the success of Incora, so every employee is eligible for one of our incentive programs.
  • We want you to enjoy life as well as work so we offer great holiday benefits such as 25 days holiday plus 8 bank holidays with a holiday buying scheme with the ability to buy up to 5 additional days
  • We want you to have peace of mind regarding your future with our generous Company pension scheme including 4 times salary life cover
  • We want to help you look after you and your family by providing healthcare cash plans saving you money and helping you to stay well
  • We want to support you and the people that matter to you with our flexible working and family friendly policies and practices
  • Incora cares about our environmental impact and that’s why we reward people who use green transport to travel to work with our Green Travel Allowance
  • We believe every little helps by offering a generous discount portal only available to Incora employees
  • Very importantly we want to be with you to help your career take off and become part of the Incora Story

So, if you feel you have all of this, and want to be part of developing the Incora Story apply now - we can’t wait to hear from you!

We are passionate about Diversity & Inclusion and we welcome applications from all persons regardless of their age, race, gender, disability, religion/belief, or sexual orientation.

Incora™ is a leading, global provider of innovative supply chain solutions. Our promise to our customers is to reduce complexity and increase reliability so they can deliver mission-critical solutions that improve our world. We exist to enable the mission critical.

With a strong foundation in the aerospace and defence markets, we also utilize our expertise to serve industrial manufacturing, marine, pharmaceuticals, and beyond. We manage all aspects of supply chain from procurement to warehouse management, from logistics to on-site customer services.

We pride ourselves on offering:

  • Industry-leading capabilities
  • Innovative solutions
  • Greater customer value
  • Trusted supplier relationships
  • Business growth and operational efficiency

  • Sick pay

  • Work from home

  • Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

title: Database Administrator
description:
Would you like to work for a dynamic technology company in Nottingham? Data is at the heart of everything we do, and by joining the TDX Group we want you to help lead the way by utilising your hands-on DBA skills and expertise!

This is an exciting opportunity to join TDX as we continue our transformation to Google Cloud. This role offers the opportunity to work with public and private sector clients, partner with Google to evolve our software, daily interaction with colleagues across the business including operations, analysts and technology and work on leading technologies.

As well as helping to maintain and improve our existing capabilities (which are primarily Microsoft based - MS SQL Server, SSIS, SSRS, SSAS), we are looking for someone to help drive and shape best practices around how we manage and use our data and partner with our MS SQL Server DBA Team Lead. As our transformation gathers pace we need skilled individuals like you to help us migrate to the cloud, moving and re-shaping our data as we go.

Training opportunities will be provided via Coursera as well as the chance to partner and learn from others. You will also be actively encouraged and sponsored to become Google certified!

About TDX Group - An Equifax Company

We've been a pioneer in the debt recovery industry for over a decade, helping businesses drive fair and appropriate consumer treatment by using data and intelligence.

We meet the exacting standards of our clients who are some of the biggest banking, retail and utility names as well as the UK government. The key to TDX's success has been the scope to build and deliver industry-leading performance portfolios, combining precise execution with high quality analytical insight and continuous creativity to our partners.

What you’ll do

  • Balance good practice, maintainability, company goals, regulatory requirements, security and user needs into solutions

  • Maintaining the day-to-day availability of all database servers

  • Responsible for implementing and maintaining a strong approach to system monitoring

  • Experience in managing high performance and availability of the databases that support critical business systems in a 24/7 environment

  • You will manage the databases through the entire product lifecycle including design, development, testing and deployment and also run / maintenance tasks (backups, incident management, managing performance etc).

  • Work independently to implement medium-large solutions.

  • Identify and the implement automatable activities in order to improve efficiency and makes recommendations on other areas for improvement

  • Define and enhance quality assurance and quality control processes to reduce the number of production incidents

  • Develop, manage and test back-up and recovery plans

What experience you need

  • MS SQL Server DBA skills; working with SQL20016 to SQL2019

    • Administering and configuring SQL Server for optimal use

    • SQL Maintenance: Backups/Integrity checks/Index Maintenance

    • Using Monitoring tools/Working with SQL Server error logs

    • Experience of TDE and TLS

    • SQL Replication

    • Upgrading/patching SQL Server

    • Experience in complex T-SQL Code

    • Documentation of processes

  • Junior to mid DBA currently

  • Experience of database development in a large complex environment

  • Strong data modeling and design skills, performance tuning of MS SQL Server databases

  • Be available for the on call rota

  • SC clearance is required on joining

What could set you apart

  • Active Cloud Certification strongly preferred

  • Experience of databases in cloud, especially on Google Platform - e.g. Cloud SQL, Big Query

  • Migration of SQL Databases from Data Centers to Cloud Platforms

  • Working with clients and security teams on yearly security audits

  • Working on large databases that are multiple terabytes in size

  • Understanding of MS SQL Server BI toolset - SSAS (OLAP Cubes), SSIS, SSRS

  • GITHub and Jenkins experience

  • Good understanding of agile methodologies

#LI-KB1

title: Database Administrator
description:
SQL Server Database Administrator / DBA

Burton upon Trent / Hybrid Working

c£45,000 + Bonus + Excellent Benefits
We’re looking for an experienced SQL Server DBA to join an awesome IT Team based in Burton upon Trent to manage the development and support of MS SQL Databases that support their applications. Delivering a first-class service, you will ensure the optimal performance and security of all production databases, advise of potential risks and mitigations, and proactively take steps to ensure smooth performance.

We are looking for strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills, along with;
  • Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
  • In-depth SQL Server Database Administration experience
  • Experience of managing multiple MS SQL 2014 & MS SQL 2016
  • Strong self-sufficiency and initiative working on projects
  • Practical experience monitoring and tuning a database to provide high availability service
  • Experience of Transactional SQL and DTS stored procedures
  • Practical experience in managing the internal and external MS SQL database security
  • Experience with High Availability Databases

Working as part of a multi-discipline team, the role includes;
  • Responsibility for ensuring availability and performance of the databases
  • Working to ensure that the associated hardware resources are allocated to the databases and a high resilience (including performance tuning as required)
  • Proactively monitoring database systems to ensure secure services with minimum downtime (SQL Server 2014 & SQL Server 2016)
  • Responsibility for providing meaningful analysis to support any informed decisions regarding resource management
  • Troubleshooting and problem solving in the SQL environment
  • Taking ownership and to be the point of contact for escalated queries in the event of issues
  • Responsibility for Installation, configuration and upgrading of Microsoft SQL Server software and related products (for example SSRS)
  • Responsibility for implementation and release of database changes, service packs etc. according to agreed timescales and costs
  • Establishing and maintaining sound backup and recovery policies and procedures
  • Responsible for restoration of the environment in the event of invoking Disaster Recovery
  • Implementing and maintaining database security (create and maintain users and roles, assign privileges)
  • Application Support for various applications, for example Dynamics NAV 2018 & EDI data flows
If you think you’ve got what it takes, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Database Administrator
description:
A young and rapidly expanding company we are growing our technical team. We are looking for a skilled SQL Server DBA Consultant to come on board and join our highly experienced team of Database Administrators who have a proven track record in delivering market leading Database Managed Services.


Your role will be to provide DBA support and Strategic Consultancy through remote and onsite delivery.


Required Skills:


  • Expert SQL Server skills (additional Oracle knowledge advantageous)
  • At least 4 years’ Database Administration experience
  • Ability to communicate with all levels within the customer environment, up to and including C-Level
  • Capability to generate confidence in your technical proficiency
  • Ability to recognise the opportunity for ongoing services and to position accordingly with the customer
  • Multiple version capability with understanding of future technology road-map
  • Expertise in complex environments - i.e. Virtualised and Clustered Systems
  • Expertise in High Availability architectures and setting up back-up and recovery procedures
  • Excellent written skills and report production a must

Key Responsibilities:


  • To provide high quality DBA support services to business clients
  • To deliver work in adherence with security and operational processes
  • To be reliable, punctual and to work with agreed service level agreements
  • To help develop and mentor junior members of the technical team
  • To give full commitment to developing skills and attending training courses as provided

Remuneration:


  • Up to £50k + Bonus
  • Company pension
  • Lap-top & phone
  • Expenses

title: Database Administrator
description:
This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced DBA to join an established & industry leading ERP-based software house

List of duties include but are not limited to:

  • Established skills in T-SQL programming

  • A deep understanding of Microsoft SQL Server fundamentals including, indexes, statistics, query plans, tempdb, installation, configuration, DMVs and, troubleshooting

  • A good understanding relational table design including normalisation, constraints, OLAP vs OLTP, traditional data warehousing

  • Experienced in critical thinking and troubleshooting

  • Experience with Azure SQL Database and Azure SQL Managed instance would be beneficial

  • Experience with Power BI would be beneficial but not essential

  • Ability to communicate confidently with technical, non-technical, internal, and external personnel

This is a chance for a well-qualified, and experienced DBA, to use their wider experience to step into a senior role in our core data services team. In a fast moving and intellectually challenging environment, our goal is to improve overall user satisfaction through product design and delivery.

The system operates on a complex set of SQL Server databases across many different customer environments (including AWS and Azure). Working closely with the Head of Data Services you will be responsible for a wide scope of database support functions including, design, support, performance, and disaster recovery.

Salary negotiable.

Please send your CV to davidh2@prophet.co.uk or call David Houlihan on +44 (0)7931 954824.

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
Did you know that 20% of electricity generated powers a pump? Enviroflex have been manufacturing specialist pumps and parts to industry in the UK and internationally for many years.

We are a small team looking to grow the business and we have recently moved into new larger premises in Derby. You will become a vital team member and point of contact for our wide client base.

Job Role: Sales Administrator / Customer Service Advisor

Enviroflex Limited are looking for an enthusiastic Administrator /Advisor to form part of our Team. You will be responsible for performing the day-to-day administration, dealing directly with suppliers and customers. A great team player with a professional & confident proactive nature.

Responsibilities:

As a Sales Administrator you will carry out a wide range of duties. Working closely with the team to ensure orders are processed and quotes are sent in a timely manner. Maintain the CRM, track leads and convert quotes to sales orders. Dealing with customers calling in/emailing from all over the world.

Essential Duties

  • Answering incoming calls
  • Dealing with email quote requests
  • Taking accurate messages
  • Preparation of quotations for our products and services
  • Processing incoming orders
  • Emailing Quotations
  • Updating company database
  • Sending purchase orders
  • Occasional Pick/Pack and dispatch (Covering holidays/Sickness)

Education and/or Work Experience Requirements:

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including ability to effectively communicate with internal and external points of contact.
  • Excellent computer proficiency (MS Office – Word, Excel and Outlook)

Benefits:

  • 20 Days holiday, increasing by 1 day per complete calendar year worked (to a maximum of 25) Plus Bank Holidays. 3 days must be saved for Christmas shutdown
  • Company Pension Scheme: Standard pension to be contributed to after a successful 6 month probation period
  • Work Fleeces and polo shirts on request

To apply for this position, please submit your resume and cover letter highlighting your relevant experience. Only qualified candidates will be contacted for an interview.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £24,000.00-£27,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company pension
  • Free parking
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • No weekends

Experience:

  • Sales administration: 1 year (required)
  • administration: 1 year (preferred)

Ability to Commute:

  • Derby, DE24 8GZ (required)

Ability to Relocate:

  • Derby, DE24 8GZ: Relocate before starting work (required)

Work Location: In person

Reference ID: EFX/ADMIN
Expected start date: 26/02/2024

title: Administrator
description:
We’re delighted to present a fantastic opportunity for a skilled Administrator to join a supportive family-run business with an excellent range of employee benefits.

The successful applicant will provide seamless clerical support within the Property Team. As well as delivering administrative support, you will be involved with maintaining the property database, assisting with business rates and carrying out legal work.

This is a truly varied role and an exciting chance to become part of a forward-thinking business which is extremely well-respected in its sector on a national scale.

Hours of work:

  • Monday – Friday, 9.00am – 5.30pm each day with 1 hour lunch break

Salary and benefits:

  • £25,000
  • Discretionary bonus scheme
  • Employee discount
  • Access to company holiday homes
  • 20 days annual leave (+ bank holidays)
  • Additional birthday day off
  • On-site parking

As Property Administrator, you’ll have the following duties and responsibilities:

  • Answering phone calls and emails for the Team
  • Carrying out filing and archiving of various documents and invoices
  • Creating and maintaining spreadsheets and the property database as and when required
  • Sorting, distributing and sending daily post
  • Helping with the Acquisitions process via site searches for new shops and other properties.
  • Producing documents and reports
  • Acting as the point of contact for business rates settlement reports and VOA correspondence
  • Assisting the Regional Estates Manager with managing and maintaining the master rates schedule.
  • Opening new legal files to include printing all relevant initial documentation for review by relevant lawyer.
  • Assist on agreed post-completion work as and when required.
  • Providing holiday cover for fellow Property Administrator.

We’re looking for a Property Administrator with the following skills and experience:

  • Extensive experience in a similar administrative role, ideally in a commercial property-related environment, but this is not essential
  • Strong IT proficiency; confident user of MS Office, particularly Excel.
  • Recognises the important of attention to detail and accuracy
  • Excellent time management and prioritisation skills.
  • Communicates confidently and effectively with colleagues, both verbally and in writing
  • Works with a positive, helpful and team-focused approach

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £25,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Employee discount
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

  • Bonus scheme

Work Location: In person

title: Administrator
description:
FOSTERING PEOPLE

Role: Administrator – 11 Months Fixed Term

Salary: £19,500 Per Annum

Benefits: 30 days' Annual Leave + Bank Holidays, Company Pension, Life Assurance x2, Employee Discount Scheme, Medical Cash Plan & On-site Free Parking

Location: Office Based - Nottingham

ABOUT US

Fostering People is a highly accredited community based fostering agency with over 20 years' experience of changing lives.

Fostering People first opened its doors in 2000, when a local social worker came up with the idea of starting a new, independent fostering service in the East Midlands.

Her idea was to provide plenty of excellent personal support, right in the heart of the local community. Today, this still holds true – except we’re now present in even more communities: Scotland, the North East, North West, West Midlands, East of England and Yorkshire. In these places, the excellence of our work means we’re the preferred choice of partner for many local authorities, who trust us to provide a high quality and caring local service. Just as importantly, so do foster parents in these communities.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

We are seeking a reliable Administrator to join our friendly and dedicated team at Fostering People Nottingham.

DUTIES INCLUDE:

  • Undertake a wide range of administrative tasks and duties using keyboard, office and IT skills
  • Act as an admin support for foster carers and social workers
  • Co-ordination of training and meetings and events
  • Completion of monthly tasks according to deadlines
  • Recording of essential company information to third parties on our database (CHARMS)
  • Act as first point of contact for our customers and portray a positive, professional and helpful image of the organisation
  • Understand and follow unique processes
  • Note/Minute taking at meetings where appropriate
  • Cover reception duties (lunch/annual leaves)

ESSENTIAL CRITERIA:

  • Previous Administrative experience
  • Solid educational background to include GCSE Grade C (or equivalent) in English and Mathematics
  • Be able to evidence an understanding of the use of IT and electronic communications including the use of Microsoft Office in particular Word, Excel and Outlook email
  • A good knowledge of administrative systems and processes
  • Be able to demonstrate effective communication
  • Ability to work under pressure and handle changing priorities

For an informal discussion about this post please contact Sophie Weightman – Office Manager on 0115 9455445.

To be considered for this post, please complete an application.

No agencies please.

Fostering People is an equal opportunities employer and has been awarded the disability confident employer by the jobcentre plus. The successful applicant will be subject to a DBS check at enhanced level if successful for the position.

Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract

Salary: £19,500.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Free parking
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Store discount

Work Location: In person

title: Office Administrator
description:
Job Description - Office Administrator

Principle Duties and Accountabilities:

· Answering the telephone, dealing with queries and enquiries, managing emails, responding to email and requests.

· Typing letters and general correspondence.

· General office duties of typing letters, general correspondence, filing, scanning, photocopying.

· To update and maintain all files both electronically and paper, ensuring data is accurate at all times.

· You will take responsibility for compliance, supporting team in achieving quality standards.

· To fulfill the requirements of equal opportunities policy and procedures and implement equality principles and practices within the context of the job.

· To keep Training Officers diary and ensure they are informed of all meetings/appointments.

· To provide administration support to the Manager and other departments.

· To follow all Health and Safety Procedures.

· Reference checks and produce hr paperwork.

· Prioritise and organise own day-to-day work and tasks, as well as ongoing programmes of work to meet set priorities and timescales.

· Undertake any other duties/tasks assigned

· Produce certificates & maintain Training Matrix to assist and support the Training Officer.

Essential Criteria:

· Experience in administrative systems, procedures and coordination.

· Strong planning and organising skills.

· Proficiency in word processing, spreadsheet, database skills.

· High standard of literacy and numeracy.

· Excellent IT skills.

· Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

· Ability to work autonomously using own initiative and as a member of a team with minimal supervision.

· Flexibility.

· Be able to produce documents/reports to a high standard, sometimes from handwritten notes.

· Demonstrate the ability to prioritise own workload in order to meet deadlines.

· Attitude is critical, our service is ever changing therefore it is important that the candidate is able to shift and change with the priorities and demands of the day.

· The post holder may be reasonably expected to undertake other duties commensurate with the level of responsibility that may be allocated from time to time. It is the responsibility of the post holder to comply with Health and Safety and Equal Opportunities requirements at all times.

· Monday to Friday 09a.m. to 5p.m.

· Any offer of employment is subject to successful references and enhanced DBS check.

Salary; Competitive

Offices based in Burton on Trent

**As a Company, we do not offer sponsorship at this time

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Licence/Certification:

  • Driving Licence (required)

Work Location: In person

title: Systems Administrator
description:
Benefits Include: Free Parking Social Events £2,000 Annual Training Budget £500 Employee Referral Scheme Cycle to Work Scheme Free Hosting Run any Desktop OS And More…


Hybrid Working – Office based work required as part of role.

CWCS Managed Hosting is a rapidly growing IT company based in Nottingham. We have thousands of customers in the UK and overseas using our shared web hosting, dedicated servers, colocation and cloud hosting services. We have an excellent reputation and deliver great customer service, high quality technical support and enterprise-grade hosting products.

Due to our continued growth we are looking to add to our excellent Systems Administration team. The role includes some on-call responsibilities, which are shared across other members of the team. As part of CWCS you will help to deliver service to meet our customer’s expectation, and in line with SLAs, ensuring that quality is delivered at every opportunity.

You must have a passion for technical issues, a keen eye for detail, and patience to investigate an issue and deliver a resolution in a timely fashion. Our Trustpilot reviews are indicative of our results so far, service means everything to our customers and our purpose is to always offer a level of service that goes above and beyond.

General Responsibilities

The Systems Administration team are critical in delivering services to our customers, being responsible for the management of key accounts, maintaining security best practice, supporting our 2nd line team, and working with the Sales departments on proposals.

You will take on different functions within the team, split across three areas:

Escalations – Help deliver resolutions to tickets that have been escalated from our 2nd line team, and dealing with high priority customers directly.

Maintenance – Carrying out server maintenance on customer’s operating systems and hardware. Proactive maintenance is critical to managing customer’s perceptions of our support.

Research and Development Training – Research new technologies and processes that help to automate our systems and deliver a consistent level of service. You will also be expected to continually train so that your knowledge helps the business deliver on its goals.

These functions have many components within them, a small example of these are:

  • Server provisioning, custom scripts, and migrations, ensuring they are completed on time and on budget.
  • Monitor the network and resolve issues appropriately.
  • Oversee the regular auditing and patching of core and customer systems.
  • Perform routine audits of systems and software.
  • Build relationships with key managed customers.
  • Train junior members of the technical operations centre.
  • Develop knowledgebase documentation.
  • Research, develop and implement new products and services.

The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate a commitment to quality and information systems standards and a strong technical aptitude and ability to research and resolve complex issues. You will be self-motivated and keen to work as part of a team.

Benefits

We offer an excellent salary for this level of position. Training budget of £2,000 per year to help you develop the skills that drive the growth of the business.

Experience

You should have a good knowledge of internet technologies, specifically those used to deliver website hosting. You should also be able to understand the interaction between hardware and software. Confidence of working with networks, and being able to diagnose faults is also crucial. Other areas of knowledge that would be required:

  • Experience of VMware (vSphere, vSAN) system administration and maintenance.
  • Linux and Windows administrative knowledge.
  • Virtualisation and virtual machine management.
  • Familiarity with open source tools.
  • Networking concept.
  • Diagnostic skills, and lateral thinking.
  • Basic database administration including MySQL (MariaDB) and MSSQL.
  • Ability to learn new technologies.
  • A Linux or Microsoft certification would be advantageous.
  • Evidenced right to work in the UK is a pre-requisite for this role.

This role would be of particular interest to someone with a qualification in a VMware looking to advance their career, and with a keen desire to improve their knowledge on a diverse amount of technologies.

Working Hours

37.5 hours per week including an on-call requirement

Job Type: Permanent

Salary: £30,000.00-£40,000.00 per year

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Further Information

For more information about our Systems Administrator role including a detailed job description, please contact jobs@cwcs.co.uk.

To Apply

To apply for this position, please send your CV and a cover letter to jobs@cwcs.co.uk.

No Agencies Please!

title: Administrator
description:
• Reputable business offering progression
  • Free Onsite parking, City Centre Location

About Our Client

Pioneering force in the engineering manufacturing sector, specialising in the creation of innovative products. With a strong commitment to quality and technological advancement, the business are at the forefront of shaping the future of the industry. Currently seeking a meticulous and detail-oriented Quotes Administrator to join the team and contribute to the efficiency of the quoting processes.

Job Description

Key Responsibilities of a Quotes Administrator:


  • Quote Preparation: Prepare accurate and timely quotes for customers based on product specifications and pricing guidelines.


  • Data Analysis: Collaborate with sales, engineering, and procurement teams to gather and analyse data for accurate quoting.


  • Communication: Maintain effective communication with internal teams to ensure clarity on product details, pricing, and customer requirements.


  • Documentation: Organise and maintain a comprehensive database of quotes, ensuring accuracy and accessibility.


  • Customer Interaction: Engage with customers to clarify requirements, provide additional information, and address any questions related to quotes.


  • Process Improvement: Identify opportunities to streamline and improve the efficiency of the quoting process.


  • Collaboration: Work closely with sales administrators, engineers, and other relevant departments to ensure seamless operations.

The Successful Applicant

The successful Quotes Administrator will have:


  • Proven experience as a Quotes Administrator, Sales Support, or in a similar administrator role.


  • Strong analytic skills with the ability to interpret technical data.


  • Meticulous attention to detail and a commitment to accuracy.


  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.


  • Proficiency in office software (Microsoft Office suite) and experience with quoting software.


  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and collaborative work environment.

What's on Offer

In return you will receive:


  • Opportunities for professional development and growth within a leading engineering manufacturing company.


  • A dynamic and innovative work environment.


  • The chance to contribute to the success of groundbreaking products in the engineering sector.
  • Generous company pension scheme
  • Discretionary company bonus

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
JOB TITLE: School Administrative Assistant - Term time hours
LOCATION: Leicester
SALARY: £21,192 to £21,579 Pro-rata
CONTRACT TYPE: Contract until October 2024
HOURS: 10.00am - 4.00pm (27.5 hour week) Monday to Friday

The COMPANY
Our client is a well-established Primary School based in Oadby, Leicester. They are a vibrant and multicultural primary school. For a maternity cover the school are looking to appoint an experienced person to undertake general administrative support and general reception duties.

The ROLE
The successful School Administrator will be required to do the following:

  • To support the Headteacher, Deputy headteacher and Office Manager in administrative tasks
  • To receive visitors, parents, carers, governors plus other guests, and deal with their requests in an efficient and professional manner and hospitality as appropriate
  • Maintain the pupil database
  • Maintain correspondence between school and parents e.g. letters to parents, parent mail, texting, staff briefing and school website etc.
  • Maintain the office diaries, calendar, and correspondence between school and parents.
  • To collect, record, and bank school income as necessary.
  • To record and monitor absences, attendance, daily registers, and liaison with outside agencies when needed.

The CANDIDATE
Our client is looking for School Administrator / receptionist applicants with the following experience and attributes:
  • Experience of working in an office environment, preferably within a school.
  • Experience of dealing with public face to face and on the telephone
  • Able to organise own work and work with others to meet deadlines.
  • Word, PowerPoint and Excel. SIMS experience (desirable, not essential)
  • Willingness to undertake training of the SIMS software used in Schools.
  • Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills.

ALTERNATIVE JOB TITLES: School Office Manager, School Administrator, School Office Administrator, Admin, Administrator, School Secretary

This role is commutable from:
Leicester
Oadby
Wigston
Market Harborough
Great Glen
Kibworth

Mana Resourcing is a specialist recruitment company working within the Engineering, Sales, IT and Commercial sectors. We are established to service and support the recruitment requirements of modern businesses and candidates alike. This particular role includes people with experience in School Office Manager, School Administrator, School Office Administrator, Admin, Administrator, School Secretary.

title: Administrator
description:
Job Description


We are looking for an Administrator to join our friendly team based in our East Midlands Airport office (DE74 2SA).

No payroll experience is required, as full training will be provided.

This position would suit an experienced Administrator looking to join a fast-growing business that can offer support, training and development and opportunities to enhance their career.

This is a full-time (40 hrs) permanent office-based position covering flexible business hours between 0830 hrs – 1730 hrs Monday to Friday.

In return, the Office Administrator will be offered:
  • Opportunities to win our Employee of the month recognition programme, including £100 in vouchers + champagne + trophy.
  • Paid day off on your birthday and for Christmas shopping.
  • Dress down Fridays + Free tea and coffee.
  • High street retail discounts subscription (PerkBox).
  • Free onsite airport parking to use on your holidays.

The duties of the Office Administrator will involve:
  • Processing of payroll, SSP and Holiday Pay onto the company database.
  • Administer pay and client rate and legislative changes onto CRM.
  • Assisting Credit Control team with payroll and invoice queries.
  • Processing company car mileage and business expenses.
  • Processing new starters and leavers and P45 requests.
  • Assisting with monthly payroll and compliance audits.
  • Assist Recruitment Consultants and Senior Managers with day-to-day administrative support.

To be successful in the role of Office Administrator, you must have the following skills and experience:

  • Experience working as an Office Administrator, Sales Administrator, Administration Assistant, and Customer Service Administrator. Finance Administrator or
Credit Control Administrator where your duties have involved outbound telephone and data input activity.
  • Experience in working on multiple administrative tasks.
  • Experience with Microsoft Outlook, Word and Excel.
  • Working to strict deadlines.

About the Company:

Aviation Recruitment Network Ltd is one of the UK’s recognised specialist suppliers of high-volume security-cleared personnel for the Commercial Aviation Industry.

Our clients range from airport operators, international airlines, ground handling companies, support services, and household names in hospitality, transport, and logistics.

If you feel you have the skills and experience for this position, we would love to hear from you.
Click the link below or call our office to speak to Steve Freeman.

title: Data Administrator
description:
I have an unmissable opportunity up for grabs for the role of C# Software developer, (mid level or Junior)!

·Are you passionate about creating excellent code?

·Would you like to work with a fantastic tech stack?

·Would you like to work for a company that values your time so offers hybrid working enabling you to both do your best work and maintain a healthy work life balance?

·Would you like to work alongside a 1st class team in a collaborative environment working to best agile practices?

·Are you looking for career progression within a company that has clear paths to furthering your career?

If the above applies to you and you are either a talented C# developer then read on as this job is perfect for you!

Key functions of the role and experience required:

·Minimum of 2 – 4 year’s experience of C#

·You are someone that takes pride in writing clean, maintainable and well documented C# code that follows best practices and standards.

·Be someone who loves to learn and stay up to date with the latest and emerging technologies.

·You have a solid understanding of SQL.

·Inquisitive! Someone that has strong problem-solving skills and an analytical mid would do really well in this role.

·My client believes in collaboration, so strong communication and teamwork skills are required.

·They use Azure and whereby no experience is required in this area to apply and be successful, should you have any it would be considered an advantage.

Benefits:

-Hybrid working! Work the way you work best! Maintain a healthy work life balance!

·Generous salary which is negotiable dependent on experience.

·Stability and job security! Work in an industry unaffected by market conditions we have experienced in the past such as the pandemic and recession.

·Excellent benefits including a solid pension scheme.

·Work with an amazing team in a collaborative Agile environment1

·Don’t have cloud experience but would like to? My client uses Microsoft Azure which you will get to work with!

·Clear career paths in place to take your career to the next level be that junior to mid or mid to senior.

I have an excellent relationship with the client meaning that turnaround will be very fast so if you think the above sounds like you and the opportunity excites you, apply ASAP to avoid disappointment!

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: £25,000.00-£30,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Free parking
  • Private medical insurance
  • Sick pay
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Tamworth

Reference ID: C#

title: Administrator
description:
PA Administrator

Location: West Bridgford, Nottingham

Salary: up to £36,000 + discretionary bonus

Hours: Full time (35-hour week)

An excellent opportunity has arisen for a professional PA or Administrator with Financial Services experience, to join this friendly and proactive St. James’s Place Partner Practice, who specialise in providing bespoke Financial Planning solutions for Professionals, Private Clients, and Business Owners.
This is an interesting and rewarding role that would suit a proactive, confident, and professional individual with a willingness to take on responsibility, and a real ‘eye for detail.’

The Role: PA Administrator

Based in a brand-new office in a central location you will be working closely with the Partner providing a high level of operational and administrative support and superb customer service to clients of the Practice.

  • You will be meeting and greeting visitors to the practice and be the ‘Go To person’ for clients, building effective working relationships.
  • You will be responsible for managing the partner’s diary, arranging, and preparing for client meetings, collating data for reports, illustrations, and portfolio reviews.
  • You will be dealing with general enquiries, chasing providers for funds and information, and liaising with SJP back-office teams.
  • You will be responsible for submitting new business (mainly pensions and investments) ensuring this is recorded and tracked efficiently and in line with Practice and regulatory standards.
  • Managing the database of clients using Salesforce CRM
  • Composing high quality correspondence to clients and providers
  • You will understand the importance of getting things right first time, so your attention-to-detail is second to none.

For this role you will need the following attributes:

  • A proven track record as an effective Administrator
  • Highly organised and able to make independent decisions.
  • Experience of prioritising your workload, managing tasks, processes, and workflows.
  • Confidence in dealing with clients, colleagues, third parties and the ability to work autonomously and with total discretion.
  • Experience of Salesforce CRM
  • Knowledge of Aptus would be an advantage
  • Experience of working for a St. James’s Place Partner Practice or in a Financial Services business is an advantage but not essential.

The office is based in an easy to get to central location with free parking. Other benefits include a discretionary bonus, pension, and 25 days holidays + bank holidays, increasing each year to a maximum of 30.

St. James’s Place Wealth Management plc (SJP) is a leading, and highly regarded, FTSE 100 UK Wealth Management company which distributes a range of Investment and Retirement products and financial solutions to a High-Net-Worth client base. SJP has funds under management in excess of £157bn.
Please note that this Partner Practice will conduct a standard Financial and Identity check on any candidates who are offered a role within this Practice.


When applying for this role, you will be directed to the application site of Burgh Recruitment. Please ensure you tick the Privacy Policy box and click the green 'apply to this job' at the bottom of the application page. Once your application is completed, you will receive a confirmation email from Burgh Recruitment.

SQL Database Administrator

08012024VSNFI42_1704730252

I'm looking for an experienced SQL Server Database Administrator to join a 3 x Microsoft Gold Certified Managed Services Provider, who specialise in DBA and development work. They are a relatively small and close-knit company, who operate on a fully-remote basis, with quarterly meet ups to get together, socialise, and celebrate their successes!

Reporting into their Technical Team Lead, you will work as part of a growing team of DBAs to support their clients with both their on-premises and Azure-based servers, as well as helping with any migration projects where relevant.

This role is client-facing, so would be suited to someone who enjoys building relationship, solving problems, and providing exceptional customer service in everything that you do. Everyone on the team takes their turn being on-call, so realistically you can expect to spend 1 week in every couple of months on call (exact rota to be confirmed).

This is a really unique and exciting opportunity to join a successful organisation who are very much involved in the Microsoft community - they are home to a Microsoft MVP, are active participants at SQLBits, and have previously been nominated for a coveted Women in Tech Award.

In return for your hard work, you can expect to receive significant training support towards your Microsoft Certifications, as well as the freedom to explore your areas of interest.

Requirements

  • Strong SQL Server DBA experience, on-premises and ideally on Azure too
  • Experience working on migration projects to Azure would be beneficial
  • Any experience with SSIS, SSRS, SSAS, Power BI would be beneficial
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills

Benefits

  • Salary between £50-65,000 depending on level of experience
  • 10% matches pension
  • 25 days annual leave, and additional day off for birthday
  • 2 volunteering days per year
  • Paid certifications & training
  • Fully remote working



Please Note: This is a permanent role for UK residents only. This role does not offer Sponsorship. You must have the right to work in the UK with no restrictions. Some of our roles may be subject to successful background checks including a DBS and Credit Check.

Nigel Frank are the go-to recruiter for Power BI and Azure Data Platform roles in the UK, offering more opportunities across the country than any other. To find out more and speak confidentially about your job search or hiring needs, please contact me directly at v.simpson@nigelfrank.com

title: Data Administrator
description:
Summary

Job Reference:
222490BR

Nottingham Support Office

Fixed Term

37.5 hours per week

Our application process

Article Data Administrator – Boots UK

Location: Nottingham Support Office
Function area: Commercial Operations
Shift pattern: Full-time
Contract type: 9 month secondment / Fixed Term Contract
Hours per week: Over 35 hours per week

Article Data Administrator (Secondment / Fixed Term)

An exciting opportunity has arisen for an Article Data Administrator at Boots UK, the UK’s leading pharmacy-led Health and Beauty retailer. With around 2,200 stores ranging from local community pharmacies to large destination health and beauty stores, our purpose is to help our customers look and feel better than they ever thought possible. Boots UK is part of the Retail Pharmacy International Division of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc, the first global pharmacy-led health and wellbeing enterprise. For over 170 years Boots UK have been providing customers with an excellent customer experience, selling products with outstanding value, quality and choice.

About the role:
Join the Master Data Team within Commercial Operations whose principal responsibilities are the timely, accurate and controlled management of master data. The Article Data Administrator role focuses on creating and maintaining products for sales in our stores and online platform across UK and Ireland markets. Without this service products wouldn’t be available for sale.

This is an opportunity to work in a great, fast paced team with lots of opportunity and support to develop. You will have visibility of numerous departments across the business and be encouraged to drive change. The key activities involved in the role means you will have an appreciation of end to end article creation process.

Key Responsibilities:
  • To manage the timely and accurate creation and maintenance of Boots products, validating data in line with given standards
  • Achieving agreed Key Performance Indicators (KPI’s) within the role
  • Support and coach customers with data requirement queries daily
  • Produce team and customer KPI’s, such as volumes and customer rework reporting
  • Demonstrate process improvements to drive simplification
  • Governance is a key part of the role, to support communication and engagement with customers in order to deliver right first time data

A bit about you:
  • Ability to multitask and prioritise workload alongside good time management
  • The ability to work towards and hit firm deadlines
  • Well organised, excellent short and long-term planning, with brilliant attention to detail, with a right first time attitude
  • Strong ability to communicate effectively whether face to face, telephone or email
  • Collaborative team working and relationship building
  • Positive attitude, ability to deal with last minute changes and queries
  • Works well under pressure and to tight deadlines
  • Self-motivator, confident and able to use initiative to create and/or seek out solutions
  • Ability to be adaptable and flexible
  • Knowledge of Microsoft office (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, Word) essential

Our benefits:
  • Boots Retirement Savings Plan
  • Generous employee discount plus enhanced discounts for Boots brands, Boots Opticians and Boots Hearing care
  • Excellent onsite facilities including staff shop, opticians (including free eye tests for team members), gym, cafeteria, outdoor seating spaces and dry cleaning service

We have a great range of benefits in addition to the above that go beyond salary and offer flexibility to suit you;(all rewards and benefits are subject to change and eligibility).

Hybrid Working:
We offer our Support Office team members a flexible, hybrid working approach based upon empowerment, accountability, care, and trust, which includes a balanced mix of remote and office-based working - this will be discussed with you as part of the application process.

What’s next:
If your application is successful, our in-house recruitment team will be in touch to arrange an interview and to answer any initial questions you have. If you have not been successful on this occasion, you’ll be notified by email.
